title: How many books will the average literate person read? - Quora

response.answer_text: That’s a little hard to answer, because it really depends on their personal preferences. Literate means able to read. Many people can, but they choose not to. It’s weird that way. But, in Canada, I would say they read at least twelve novels. 1 for each year of school.
Depends on how comprehensive the book you get… because the easier the comprehension, the less you look for other books
